@Somto_I he's the best of the frauds. They are all frauds.
Of all frauds (aka managers), Guardiola probably least fraudulent because he's aware of his fraud status.

https://t.co/eZj3N4nQQV - I recall reading this at the time. Definitely piqued my interest. Now look at the lad!
He allowed the true tensions to be exposed (albeit not intentionally).
...influence on their outcomes was a different story - even as President, still just a cog. I'd say Obama was GREAT for race relations.
Also, blacks felt emboldened to protest and speak back/out about their problems because a black man was in power. Whether he'd have any...
I think it happens to be that his presidency coincided with explosion of social media. Oppression was brought to your phone screen.
I'd like to comment on is race relations. People say they are worse than they've ever been in 'recent' memory. And Obama is to blame? No.
I want to fault Obama for his unashamed legacy-chasing (I mean, even his farewell speech was legacy-chasing) but he's human. We all do it.
@KjSunmon another interesting feature is the growth towards mid-tempo music which I think is also part of that Ghanaian influence.
@JamsheedFCB I think in places where driving is either a necessity or an ordeal in itself, automatic cars boom (or should). Nigeria, for e.g
